poem:
**Beta Blockers in Bloom**

When the heart's rhythm  
is tempered by tiny capsules,  
an orchestra of calm unfolds—  
yet, unseen tides may rise.  
Small pills, promises of peace,  
whisper warnings, echoes  
of a white-coat lecture—  
Balance each beat carefully,  
lest the symphony  
becomes a storm.
